intro: Breonia stipulata, commonly known as the stipule breonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive stipule at the base of each leaf pair. Breonia stipulata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
